entry.title: About the small number of bitcoin nodes
entry.summary: The message discusses the small number of Bitcoin full nodes and offers suggestions for improving the network. The author proposes allowing users to view the bandwidth used by Bitcoin Core and educating users on the correct setup of a Bitcoin node. They also suggest creating a default config file for bitcoind and Bitcoin Core, adding them to Linux repos, and creating a graphical interface for bitcoind on Linux servers. Additionally, the author recommends splitting the Bitcoin wallet from the Bitcoin node, informing users if port 8333 is closed, and keeping connections if bitcoind is restarted. Overall, the author believes these changes will help increase the number of full nodes on the Bitcoin network.
